Use baking soda and water: Baking soda is a natural disinfectant and can be used as a substitute for soap. To use, simply wet your hands with water and rub them together to create a lather. The baking soda will help to remove dirt and germs without drying out your skin.

Use vinegar and water: Vinegar has antibacterial and antiviral properties that can help to kill germs and bacteria. To use, mix equal parts water and vinegar in a spray bottle and spray it onto your hands or body. Let it sit for a few minutes before rinsing with water.

Use a homemade cleanser: You can make a homemade cleanser using a mixture of water, sugar, and lemon juice. The sugar acts as a gentle exfoliant, while the lemon juice provides antibacterial properties. To use, apply the mixture to a washcloth or sponge and rub it onto your skin. Rinse with warm water.

Use a clay mask: Clay masks can be used to detoxify and purify the skin. To use, mix baking soda and water to create a paste, and apply it to your face or body. Let it sit for a few minutes before rinsing with warm water.

Use a toothbrush and toothpaste: While not specifically designed for cleaning, toothbrushes can be used to clean hard-to-reach areas of the body. Toothpaste can be used to clean teeth and gums, but it can also be used to clean surfaces and objects.
